text: 腦性麻痺其實是可以藉由讓孕婦接受疫苗注射來進行預防，而避免幼兒腦部受傷也是可達到預防效果。 目前沒有可完全治癒腦性麻痺的方法，但支持性療法、藥物治療以及手術可多少給予不同病況的患者協助。 藥物如地西泮、，和肉毒桿菌素等能幫助紓緩緊繃的肌肉會進行的手術包含延長肌肉與切除過度活躍的神經。 只要經過適當的治療，部分的病童可以擁有接近正常成年人的生活常常會有患者選擇使用替代療法，但這些療程都沒有任何研究可支持他們的實用性。
premise: Some of the causes of CP are preventable through immunization of the mother, and through efforts to prevent head injuries in children such as through improved safety. There is no known cure for CP, but supportive treatments, medication and surgery may help many individuals. This may include physical therapy, occupational therapy and speech therapy. Medications such as diazepam, baclofen and botulinum toxin may help relax stiff muscles. Surgery may include lengthening muscles and cutting overly active nerves. Often, external braces and Lycra splints and other assistive technology are helpful with mobility. Some affected children can achieve near normal adult lives with appropriate treatment. While alternative medicines are frequently used, there is no evidence to support their use.

annotations.comment:
The Chinese takes a bit of a logical leap, suggesting that CP can be "prevented" (預防) by "having" the pregnant mother "receive" immunization shots. The English merely suggests that "some of the causes of CP are preventable" through this method.

The Chinese then states explicitly that "preventing children from injuring their head" "can also achieve preventative effects," while the latter idea (that of prevention) is implied in the English, having already been laid out explicitly in the previous clause. 

EN: "There is no known cure for CP"; CN: "Currently there is no means of completely curing (完全治療) CP"

The Chinese then refers to individuals afflicted by CP with "different conditions/statuses" (不同病況). 

There is a missing period that should go after "緊繃的肌肉"; and after "生活" and before "常常."

EN: "Surgery may include"; CN: "The surgery that can be implemented includes" (會進行的手術包括, where 手術 means "surgery").

The Chinese suggests that "frequently, patients elect to use alternative medicines"; this is mainly inferable, with the exception of "patients"; we cannot know from the English alone that the use of alternative medicines to treat CP is determined by patients in most cases, as opposed to by doctors, parents, or other stakeholders in the patients' treatment. The Chinese continues: "but for these treatment courses there is no research whatsoever (任何, meaning, "any," "at all," etc.) to support their usefulness." Nothing here strikes the reader as information that could not be inferred from the Chinese. Perhaps "usefulness" connotes something slightly different than does "use," but if research supports the use of some therapy, then it can be assumed that the research has indicated that that therapy is in someway "useful" (實用).

title: 腦性麻痺
translation3: Cerebral palsy can actually be prevented by allowing pregnant women to receive vaccinations, and prevention of brain injuries in young children can also be achieved. There is currently no complete cure for cerebral palsy, but supportive care, medication, and surgery can help patients with different conditions to some extent. Medications such as diazepam, diazepam, and botulinum toxin can help relieve tight muscles. Surgery may include lengthening the muscles and removing overactive nerves. With appropriate treatment, some sick children can live nearly normal adult lives. Often, patients choose to use alternative treatments, but there is no research to support their usefulness.

Other sources include medical and industrial wastes, as well as naturally occurring radioactive materials (NORM) that can be concentrated as a result of the processing or consumption of coal, oil, and gas, and some minerals, as discussed below.

text: 二戰期間列強的研究使得雷達技術得以快速的發展，雷達就已經出現了地對空、空對地（搜索）轟炸、空對空（截擊）火控、敵我識別功能的雷達技術。 二戰以後，雷達發展了單脈衝角度跟蹤、脈衝多普勒信號處理、合成孔徑和脈衝壓縮的高分辨率、結合敵我識別的組合系統、結合計算機的自動火控系統、地形迴避和地形跟隨、無源或有源的相位陣列、頻率捷變、多目標探測與跟蹤等新的雷達體制。
premise: The modern uses of radar are highly diverse, including air and terrestrial traffic control, radar astronomy, air-defense systems, anti-missile systems, marine radars to locate landmarks and other ships, aircraft anti-collision systems, ocean surveillance systems, outer space surveillance and rendezvous systems, meteorological precipitation monitoring, altimetry and flight control systems, guided missile target locating systems, self-driving cars, and ground-penetrating radar for geological observations. Modern high tech radar systems use digital signal processing and machine learning and are capable of extracting useful information from very high noise levels.

annotations.comment:
The Chinese describes some inferable applications of radar, such as "air-to-surface" bombardment, "air-to-air fire control," and "friend-or-foe recognition." It is clear from the English that radar's utility extends to the surface and the air. It is worth noting that these applications are described as having been innovated in a rapid phase of radar development during World War II--this idea I have labelled as totally new, while the listed applications of radar I have listed as inferable. 

We know from the English that radar is broadly capable of recognizing, tracking and discriminating targets and objects; thus the applications which I have highlighted are arguably inferable.

title: 雷达
translation3: The research of the great powers during World War II enabled the rapid development of radar technology. Radar technology has already appeared with ground-to-air, air-to-ground (search) bombing, air-to-air (interception) fire control, and identification of friend or foe. After World War II, radar developed single pulse angle tracking, pulse Doppler signal processing, high resolution of synthetic aperture and pulse compression, combined system combined with identification of friend or foe, automatic fire control system combined with computer, terrain avoidance and terrain following, Passive or active phased array, frequency agility, multi-target detection and tracking and other new radar systems.

text: （中譯：越過地平線）是三星電子為智慧型裝置設計的品牌主題鈴聲，取代了早期使用的，最早在2011年推出的三星Galaxy S II上開始採用，包含裝置開關機、預設通知鈴聲和預設來電鈴聲均有使用，以「Do Do Sol Do↑ Si Sol」這6個音構成的上升下降音階作為該旋律的主軸，其原始版本由三星員工Josh Joongsam Yun構想，來電鈴聲雖然為縮減版並重新混音，但在裝置資料夾內可找到對應的完整版；即使三星在2021年推出了新的品牌主題鈴聲，但是仍然保留著。
premise: "Over the Horizon" is the trademark sound for Samsung smartphone devices, first introduced in 2011 on the Galaxy S II. It was composed by Joong-sam Yun and appears as music in the music library of most Samsung phones released since 2011. Prior to 2011, "Beyond Samsung" served as Samsung's trademark music track, while "Samsung Tune" was used as the default ringtone. The sound appears as the default ringtone, as well as the sound when the phone turns on or off (a snippet is used), and as a notification sound. While the basic composition of the six-note tune has not changed since its inception, various versions of different genres have been introduced as the product line evolved.

annotations.comment:
EN: "'Over the Horizon' is the trademark sound for Samsung smartphone devices"; CN: "...is Samsung electronic's (smart devices) brand theme ringtone." So, we can infer, moving from the Chinese to the English, that the sound would also relate to Samsung smartphones; but we cannot infer from the English to the Chinese that all Samsung "smart" devices have the same ringtone. 

The Chinese notes that Yun "conceived of" (构想) the ringtone, while the English credits him with having "composed" it. Whoever composes a piece of music most likely conceived of it, so this is inferable. 

There is not enough information to infer from the English that Yun was, as the Chinese states, a "Samsung employee" (三星员工). 

The Chinese distinguishes the "original version" of the composition from the "shortened" and "remixed" version used as the ringtone; the English makes no distinction, only noting that different variations of the original have been "introduced."

The Chinese also describes the "six notes" that comprise the ringtone, notes that they "ascend and descend," says that the original, full version of the ringtone can be found inside the phone's software, and that it has remained despite the introduction of a new brand theme by Samsung in 2021.

title: 三星Galaxy
translation3: (Chinese translation: Over the Horizon) is a brand theme ringtone designed by Samsung Electronics for smart devices. It replaced the earlier used ringtones, which were first used on the Samsung Galaxy S II launched in 2011. It includes device power on and off, default notification ringtones and The default incoming call ringtone is used. The ascending and descending scale composed of the six tones "Do Do Sol Do↑ Si Sol" is used as the main axis of the melody. The original version was conceived by Samsung employee Josh Joongsam Yun. Although the incoming call ringtone is a shortened version And remixed, but the corresponding full version can be found in the device folder; even though Samsung launched a new brand theme ringtone in 2021, it is still retained.

text: 有证据表明，存在完全包裹在木卫二冰冷外壳中的液态水湖泊，这与被认为存在于冰壳下更深处的液态海洋不同。 有证据表明，木卫二大部分表面都富含过氧化氢NA 。 由于过氧化氢在与液态水结合时会分解为氧气和水，作者认为它可能是简单生命形式的重要能量供给。
premise: Evidence suggests the existence of lakes of liquid water entirely encased in Europa's icy outer shell and distinct from a liquid ocean thought to exist farther down beneath the ice shell, as well as pockets of water that form M shaped ice ridges when the water freezes on the surface - like in Greenland. Icy Europa's mysterious double ridges may hint at hidden pockets of water . If confirmed, the lakes and pockets of water could be yet another potential habitat for life. Evidence suggests that hydrogen peroxide is abundant across much of the surface of Europa. Because hydrogen peroxide decays into oxygen and water when combined with liquid water, the authors argue that it could be an important energy supply for simple life forms.

annotations.comment:
The citation annotation should be bounded by "NA SA" and "2013. .," but there is no way to select this piece of text without including "过氧化," etc. 

"与" (meaning "and") appears in the third clause of the first sentence in the Chinese. There is something (probably the mention of "pockets of water that form M shaped ice ridges") that has been omitted from the text that makes this 与 nonsensical: The phrase reads, "this and is thought to exist."

title: 木卫二

text: 皮膚炭疽感染1至2週內即發病，初期為滋擾、發癢的皮膚損傷或黑點狀的水泡，狀似麵包久放後出現的黑色黴菌，接著形成大而無痛的壞死性潰瘍，不同於一般瘀青或大多數其他皮膚損傷，皮膚炭疽並不造成任何疼痛感，不加以治療有20%的致死率，雖較其他形式之炭疽病低，但在醫學統計上仍是非常高的數據，但治療後幾乎不會有危險。
premise: Cutaneous anthrax, also known as hide-porter's disease, is when anthrax occurs on the skin. It is the most common form (>90% of anthrax cases). It is the least dangerous form (low mortality with treatment, 23.7% mortality without). Cutaneous anthrax presents as a boil-like skin lesion that eventually forms an ulcer with a black center (eschar). The black eschar often shows up as a large, painless, necrotic ulcer (beginning as an irritating and itchy skin lesion or blister that is dark and usually concentrated as a black dot, somewhat resembling bread mold) at the site of infection. In general, cutaneous infections form within the site of spore penetration between two and five days after exposure. Unlike bruises or most other lesions, cutaneous anthrax infections normally do not cause pain. Nearby lymph nodes may become infected, reddened, swollen, and painful. A scab forms over the lesion soon, and falls off in a few weeks.

annotations.comment:
"Bread mold" is described in the Chinese as "the black fungus that appears on bread after it has been left out for a long time."

The Chinese states that cutaneous anthrax infections "do not cause any pain," while the English is more moderate about this issue.

The English suggests that left untreated, the infection causes death in the patient 23.7% of the time, while the Chinese uses the figure of 20%.  

The Chinese suggests that the infection is common and usually presents no risk after treatment.

title: 炭疽病
translation3: Cutaneous anthrax infection develops within 1 to 2 weeks. It initially appears as nuisance, itchy skin lesions or black dot-like blisters, similar to the black mold that appears on bread after being left out for a long time, and then develops into large, painless, necrotic ulcers. Cutaneous anthrax does not cause any pain compared to ordinary bruises or most other skin injuries. If left untreated, it has a 20% fatality rate. Although it is lower than other forms of anthrax, it is still very high in medical statistics. , but there is almost no danger after treatment.

text: 同樣在1887年的南海城，他受到了樸茨茅斯文學與哲學學會（Portsmouth Literary and Philosophical Society）會員的影響，他開始一系列的超自然調查。 他寫給唯靈論雜誌《Light》，宣稱自己是一名唯靈論者，並且談到一件令他信服的特殊超自然事件。
premise: In 1887, in Southsea, influenced by Major-General Alfred Wilks Drayson, a member of the Portsmouth Literary and Philosophical Society, Doyle began a series of investigations into the possibility of psychic phenomena and attended about 20 seances, experiments in telepathy, and sittings with mediums. Writing to spiritualist journal Light that year, he declared himself to be a spiritualist, describing one particular event that had convinced him psychic phenomena were real. Also in 1887 (on 26 January), he was initiated as a Freemason at the Phoenix Lodge No. 257 in Southsea. (He resigned from the Lodge in 1889, returned to it in 1902, and resigned again in 1911.)

annotations.comment:
The Chinese begins with "likewise," or "similarly," or "also in" (同樣). This has no basis in the English passage as it has been excerpted here. 

EN: "Doyle began a series of investigations"; CN: "He began a series of supernatural investigations" -- We know from the fact that the subject of his investigations concerned "supernatural" phenomena (like "telepathy") that these were "supernatural investigations," so the use of this term (超自然) in the Chinese is inferable. 

The Chinese has it as, "a made-him-believe special supernatural event." This is clearly inferable; "psychic phenomena" are "supernatural"; and for him to have been "convinced" by this event that "psychic phenomena were real," then this event must have "made him believe" in the supernatural.

並且 - and - not mentioned but can be infered from the context and the sentence flow

title: 阿瑟·柯南·道尔
translation3: Also in Southsea in 1887, he was influenced by members of the Portsmouth Literary and Philosophical Society, and he began a series of paranormal investigations. He wrote to the spiritualist magazine Light, declaring himself a spiritualist and talking about a particular supernatural event that convinced him.

text: 理查德·費曼及在他之前的厄恩斯特·斯蒂克爾堡，提出了一種對狄拉克方程負能量解的詮釋，就是正電子是逆時間而行的電子。 約翰·惠勒援引這個概念，來解釋所有電子都共有的性質，同時指出在有自相互作用的複世界線上，“它們都是一樣的電子”。 後來，南部陽一郎將這樣的一套理論，應用於所有物質－反物質對的創生與湮滅，還說明了“平常所見成對的最終創生與湮滅，並不是創生與湮滅，而是移動中的粒子改變方向而已，從過去到將來，又或是從將來到過去”。
premise: reinterpreting the negative-energy solutions of the Dirac equation. Electrons moving backward in time would have a positive electric charge. Wheeler invoked this concept to explain the identical properties shared by all electrons, suggesting that "they are all the same electron" with a complex, self-intersecting worldline. Yoichiro Nambu later applied it to all production and annihilation of particle-antiparticle pairs, stating that "the eventual creation and annihilation of pairs that may occur now and then is no creation or annihilation, but only a change of direction of moving particles, from the past to the future, or from the future to the past."

annotations.comment: We cannot infer from the English that Wheeler's first name was "John," as the Chinese suggests (約翰).

title: 正電子
translation3: Richard Feynman, and Ernst Stickelberg before him, proposed an interpretation of the negative-energy solution to Dirac's equation in which positrons are electrons traveling in reverse time. John Wheeler invoked this concept to explain the properties common to all electrons, and pointed out that in complex world lines with self-interaction, "they are all the same electrons." Later, Yoichiro Nanbu applied such a set of theories to the creation and annihilation of all matter-antimatter pairs, and also explained that "the final creation and annihilation of the pairs we usually see are not creation and annihilation, but moving The particles just change direction, from the past to the future, or from the future to the past."

text: 在某些文化中，白色代表高貴、神聖、純潔，大和族、朝鮮族、鮮卑族、契丹族、党項族、蒙古族、女真族等都崇尚白色，中國殷朝、魏晉南北朝時期也尚白，視為神聖、高貴的顏色，如晉朝太子妃婚服為白色，陳朝白帽為皇帝、皇太子專用。 在西方白色象征纯洁，是西方婚禮上的主要用色，因此稱為白色婚禮，新娘的礼服婚紗也使用白色。
premise: In Western culture, white is the color most often associated with innocence, or purity. In the Bible and in Temple Judaism, white animals such as lambs were sacrificed to expiate sins. The white lily is considered the flower of purity and innocence, and is often associated with the Virgin Mary.

annotations.comment: EN: "In Western culture, white is the color most often associated with innocence, or purity."; CN: "In the West, white symbolizes purity."

title: 白色
translation3: In some cultures, white represents nobility, sanctity, and purity. The Yamato, Korean, Xianbei, Khitan, Dangxiang, Mongolian, and Jurchen tribes all advocate white. White was also practiced during the Yin Dynasty, Wei, Jin, Southern and Northern Dynasties in China. , regarded as a sacred and noble color. For example, the wedding dress of the princess of the Jin Dynasty was white, and the white hat of the Chen Dynasty was reserved for the emperor and the crown prince. In the West, white symbolizes purity and is the main color used in Western weddings, so it is called a white wedding. The bride’s dress is also white.

But I would suggest that it is only inferable when the Chinese is read first; that is, if we first learn from the Chinese that "electron 'radiation' therapy" can "change the physical nature of materials or eliminate...microorganisms," then we are likely to find the statement in the English that "electron therapy can treat...skin lesions" to be inferable. 

But, because this idea does not appear in the English, there is no situation in which the above actually would "work."

text: 幼兒時期可能僅表現出輕微的徵兆（IQ 60-70），很容易忽略，可能直到就學階段才會被診斷出來。 即使發現孩童在學業成績上表現異常的差，但是也必須經過更進一步的判斷以確認是否為智能障礙，也有可能是學習障礙或單純的行為問題。 當長大成人時，許多輕度智能障礙者已能獨立生活，他們在其他人眼中可能僅是「較緩慢」而不會被認為是「智能障礙」。
premise: In early childhood, mild ID (IQ 50–69) may not be obvious or identified until children begin school. Even when poor academic performance is recognized, it may take expert assessment to distinguish mild intellectual disability from specific learning disability or emotional/behavioral disorders. People with mild ID are capable of learning reading and mathematics skills to approximately the level of a typical child aged nine to twelve. They can learn self-care and practical skills, such as cooking or using the local mass transit system. As individuals with intellectual disability reach adulthood, many learn to live independently and maintain gainful employment. About 85% of persons with ID are likely to have mild ID.

annotations.comment:
EN: "it may take expert assessment..."; CN: "further determination is necessary to confirm..."

EN: "...or emotional/behavioral disorders"; CN: "or merely/simply a behavioral issue."

EN: "obvious or identified until children begin school"; CN: "diagnosed until children begin school" -- a diagnosis requires identification; all diagnoses are also identifications, but not all identifications are diagnoses. So, going from English to Chinese, "diagnose" is inferable. But going from Chinese to English, "diagnose" no longer becomes inferable. However, we find that both the English and Chinese phrasings are mutually inferable. 

CN: "many people with mild ID can live independently"; EN: "...many learn to live independently"

The Chinese adds, at the end of the last sentence, that people with mild ID "may, to other people, [seem] to be "a bit slow," and [may] not be seen as "intellectually disabled."

text: 广义上特指非主要宗教（亞伯拉罕，印度宗教等）的诸宗教，包括适此定义的现当代新宗教如大本教。 稍为狭义则指非主要宗教中的原始宗教形式，特别是充斥着巫、多神、萨满、民族神话元素的具有代表性的原始宗教如雅兹迪，及由这类宗教派生的现当代新宗教如白教。 最狭义的用法是指欧洲民族，特别是日耳曼、北欧、凯尔特、斯拉夫、古希腊罗马及南欧等民族的非亚伯拉罕系民族原生宗教，及基于这些欧洲原生宗教的现当代新宗教如威卡教、日耳曼新異教運動等。
premise: The overarching contemporary pagan revival movement which focuses on nature-revering/living, pre-Christian religions and/or other nature-based spiritual paths, and frequently incorporating contemporary liberal values. This definition may include groups such as Wicca, Neo-Druidism, Heathenry, and Slavic Native Faith.

annotations.comment:
The Chinese begins by providing a broad definition of, I assume, "paganism." A narrower definition follows, then "the most narrow" use for the term is given (referring to "European non-abrahamic folk religions," especially originating from "Germanic, Northern European, Celtic, Slavic, Greek and Southern European" peoples.

"modernized religions rooted in these European-originating religions," the Chinese passage notes, may also be described as (presumably) "pagan." 

We might get the sense from the English that the religious or spiritual movements it describes are "modernized" (现代化), as the Chinese states. Of these, the Chinese and English only overlap on "Wicca" (威卡教). Nonetheless, the English includes the terms: "revival," "contemporary liberal values," and the use of "focuses," being a verb in the present tense--these all hint at a contemporary context. The Chinese does not explicitly refer to a contemporary context, but by using the term "modern" or "modernized" (现代化), implies that these new or derivative religious movements are being practiced today. 

This is a bit of a stretch, but I am going to come down on the side of "现代化" being inferable. 

Furthermore, the idea of these being "new" religions, as the Chinese suggests: 新宗教 literally meaning "new religions," is perhaps implied in the English, which notes that these "contemporary" practices constitute a "revival" of preexisting traditions, but introduce new elements (namely, "contemporary liberal values"). That is, the faiths that emerged from the pagan revival movement may constitute "new" religions, in the sense that they incorporate new elements, and are thus different from the tradition that serve as their foundation. Because this point is arguable, I am going to label "新宗教" as "inferable."

The Chinese lists some of these "new religions" (新宗教): "Wicca, the Germanic neo-paganism/neo-heathenry movement, etc."
Aside from Wicca, I am unsure if this section includes "inferable" information. As far as I'm concerned, there is nothing inherent to the term "Heathenry" that links it, without the need for explanation, to the idea of "Germanic." 

We do know that the Chinese references to "European folk [religion]" (which are identifiable as "欧洲民族" and "民族原生宗教") are inferable; all of the listed examples given in the English are inferably European in origin. Indeed, we know that Druids resided in "northern Europe" (北欧), were Celts (卡尔特), and "Slavic Native Faith" adherents were Slavs (斯拉夫).

premise: Greenwich is notable for its maritime history and for giving its name to the Greenwich Meridian (0° longitude) and Greenwich Mean Time. The town became the site of a royal palace, the Palace of Placentia from the 15th century, and was the birthplace of many Tudors, including Henry VIII and Elizabeth I. The palace fell into disrepair during the English Civil War and was demolished to be replaced by the Royal Naval Hospital for Sailors, designed by Sir Christopher Wren and his assistant Nicholas Hawksmoor. These buildings became the Royal Naval College in 1873, and they remained a military education establishment until 1998 when they passed into the hands of the Greenwich Foundation. The historic rooms within these buildings remain open to the public; other buildings are used by University of Greenwich and Trinity Laban Conservatoire of Music and Dance.

premise: Most Aloe species have a rosette of large, thick, fleshy leaves. Aloe flowers are tubular, frequently yellow, orange, pink, or red, and are borne, densely clustered and pendant, at the apex of simple or branched, leafless stems. Flowers are described as "yellow" in color (not, as the English suggests, "frequently yellow, orange, pink, or red").

text: 生命活动中，随时机体细胞的代谢不断产生酸性或碱性物质，而机体PH始终保持稳定，这主要依靠体内各种缓冲系统和肺、肾的调节来实现。 肾脏通过排出酸性物质、回吸收碱性物质的方式来调节人体体内的酸碱平衡，还可通过控制酸性和碱性物质排出量的比例来维持酸碱平衡。
premise: The two organ systems that help regulate the body's acid–base balance are the kidneys and lungs. Acid–base homeostasis is the maintenance of pH around a value of 7.4. The lungs are part of respiratory system which helps to maintain acid–base homeostasis by regulating carbon dioxide (CO2) concentration in the blood. The respiratory system is the first line of defense when the body experiences and acid–base problem. It attempts to return the body pH to a value of 7.4 by controlling the respiratory rate. When the body is experiencing acidic conditions, it will increase the respiratory rate which in turn drives off CO2 and decreases the H+ concentration, therefore increasing the pH. In basic conditions, the respiratory rate will slow down so that the body holds onto more CO2 and increases the H+ concentration and decreases the pH.

annotations.comment: The English more explicitly attributes the body's regulation of the acid-base balance to the kidneys and the lungs, while the Chinese suggests that the kidneys and the lungs are but two of the systems that regulate acid-base balance.

title: 腎
translation3: During life activities, the metabolism of body cells continuously produces acidic or alkaline substances at any time, and the body's PH always remains stable. This is mainly achieved by various buffer systems in the body and the regulation of the lungs and kidneys. The kidneys regulate the acid-base balance in the human body by excreting acidic substances and absorbing alkaline substances. They can also maintain acid-base balance by controlling the ratio of the excretion of acidic and alkaline substances.

text: 颅相学家认为大脑是心灵的器官，而心灵则由一系列不同的官能构成，每一官能对应大脑某一特定区域。 同时，颅相学家还相信，颅骨的形状是与大脑内这些区域的形状相关的，因此通过测量人的头颅便能够判断每个人的人格特質。
premise: These areas were said to be proportional to a person's propensities. The importance of an organ was derived from relative size compared to other organs. It was believed that the cranial skull—like a glove on the hand—accommodates to the different sizes of these areas of the brain, so that a person's capacity for a given personality trait could be determined simply by measuring the area of the skull that overlies the corresponding area of the brain.

The English text thus alludes to a belief that personality related to the brain in some way. 

"Phrenologist" (颅相学家) is not inferable from the English (however, what they did and/or believed is from the Chinese itself).

Arguably the entire passage is inferable. The Chinese draws conclusions that are inferable from the information presented in the English. For instance, the Chinese states: "thus, by measuring a person's cranium [they believed] it was possible to determine each person's individual propensities." The English makes it clear that this school of thought believed that the brain's shape and size corresponded to personality traits (including a person's "propensities").

premise: Rindler has observed that Einstein's heuristic argument suggested merely that energy contributes to mass. text: 在日本本土，鈴木是日本第四大的汽車製造廠，而鈴木在汽車產品陣線主要是以日本當地稱為「輕型自動車」（K-Car）等級的小型車與中小型的越野車車種著稱。 在國際市場上，鈴木機車是世界第三大的機車製造廠，而鈴木汽車在印度、東南亞等新興市場 國家是市佔率最大的汽車品牌，也是美國汽車巨擘通用汽車集團（GM）之前的企業合作夥伴之一，旗下有幾款小轎車與越野車，是與通用旗下品牌之一的雪佛蘭（Chevrolet）雙生共用。
premise: The Suzuki Loom Company started in 1909 as a manufacturer of looms for weaving silk and cotton. Today Suzuki is among the world's largest automakers, and a major brand name in important markets, including Japan and India, but no longer sells cars in North America.

text: 週期性失業（cyclical unemployment）是指由於經濟中的總需求減少，導致勞動人口過剩，從而出現失業情況。 這種失業被歸類為非自願性失業，因為人們是有能力並且願意工作，只是社會的總需求減少以致勞 如何解決週期性失業向來是經濟學家的重點研究對象，經濟學界裡提出數種方法，例如：工人或工會自願降低工資；增加對企業部門的投資誘導，提高總需求；政府運用財政政策，補充私人投資的不足，填補和總需求的差距等等。
premise: Though there have been several definitions of "voluntary" and "involuntary unemployment" in the economics literature, a simple distinction is often applied. Voluntary unemployment is attributed to the individual's decisions, but involuntary unemployment exists because of the socio-economic environment (including the market structure, government intervention, and the level of aggregate demand) in which individuals operate. In these terms, much or most of frictional unemployment is voluntary since it reflects individual search behavior. Voluntary unemployment includes workers who reject low-wage jobs, but involuntary unemployment includes workers fired because of an economic crisis, industrial decline, company bankruptcy, or organizational restructuring.

annotations.comment:
The reasoning given for cyclical unemployment's being categorized as "involuntary unemployment"--"people are able and willing to work, but society's overall demand declines“ would support an inferred understanding of cyclical unemployment, although this term is absent from the English. 

The Chinese discusses "cyclical unemployment," which it suggests "is grouped with involuntary unemployment." The English does not mention "cyclical unemployment," but does discuss "frictional unemployment" and "involuntary unemployment." If involuntary unemployment encapsulates "cyclical unemployment," and if "involuntary unemployment" is, as the English tells us, germane to the field of economics, then it could be inferred that cyclical unemployment, as a type of involuntary unemployment, would be a subject of interest and study by economists (albeit, the Chinese goes further, saying that this is a major research topic).

I have labelled as inferable the sample of methods proposed by economists to alleviate involuntary unemployment ("workers or labor unions voluntarily lower their pay; increase the attractiveness of investment in enterprises and increase overall demand; use of fiscal policy by the government to supplement insufficient private investment to make up for the disparity in overall demand; etc.")--these methods intuitively correspond to the list of causes of involuntary unemployment given in the English, which are "economic crisis, industrial decline, company bankruptcy, or organizational restructuring." Admittedly, the latter cause is not as clearly reflected in the list of possible solutions.

title: 失業
translation3: Cyclic unemployment refers to unemployment due to a reduction in aggregate demand in the economy, resulting in a surplus of labor force. This kind of unemployment is classified as involuntary unemployment, because people are able and willing to work, but the total demand of society is reduced to labor. How to solve cyclical unemployment has always been a key research object of economists. The economics community has proposed several methods. Methods, for example: workers or trade unions voluntarily reduce wages; increase investment inducement in the corporate sector to increase aggregate demand; the government uses fiscal policy to supplement the lack of private investment and fill the gap with aggregate demand, etc.

text: 已知最早的类似日记的书是《梅勒日记》，这是一本古埃及航海日志，其作者描述了石灰石从图拉到吉萨的运输，很可能覆盖在大金字塔的外面。 现存最古老的日记来自中东和东亚文化，尽管更早的作品To Myself（Τὰ εἰς ἑαυτόν），今天被称为冥想，由罗马皇帝马库斯·奥勒留在公元 2 世纪下半叶用希腊文写成，已经显示出日记的许多特点。 枕边书日本宫廷淑女和亚洲旅行杂志提供了这种写作类型的某些方面，尽管它们很少只包含日间记录。
premise: The earliest known book resembling a diary is the Diary of Merer, an ancient Egyptian logbook whose author described the transportation of limestone from Tura to Giza, likely to clad the outside of the Great Pyramid. The oldest extant diaries come from Middle Eastern and East Asian cultures, although the even earlier work To Myself , today known as the Meditations, written in Greek by the Roman Emperor Marcus Aurelius in the second half of the 2nd century AD, already displays many characteristics of a diary. Pillowbooks of Japanese court ladies and Asian travel journals offer some aspects of this genre of writing, although they rarely consist exclusively of diurnal records.

annotations.comment:
"Logbook" in English is supplemented with "maritime" or "seagoing" in the Chinese, which is arguably inferable from the English. 
The portion "枕边书 日本 宫廷 淑女" is rather awkward, appearing to have been translated word-for-word from English. It reads, literally, "pillowbooks Japan court ladies," while the proper Chinese should read literally as "Japan court ladies' pillowbooks."

The Chinese phrase is mostly translated back to magazines, and another phrase - 日志 - works better in this scenario. The oldest surviving diaries come from Middle Eastern and East Asian cultures, although the earlier work To Myself (Τὰ εἰς ἑαυτόν), known today as Meditations, was written in Greek by the Roman Emperor Marcus Aurelius in the second half of the 2nd century AD Written, it has shown many characteristics of a diary. Pillow books, Japanese court ladies and Asian travel magazines offer some aspects of this writing genre, although they rarely contain only daytime records.

premise: The jaws of sharks, like those of rays and skates, are not attached to the cranium. The jaw's surface (in comparison to the shark's vertebrae and gill arches) needs extra support due to its heavy exposure to physical stress and its need for strength. It has a layer of tiny hexagonal plates called "tesserae", which are crystal blocks of calcium salts arranged as a mosaic. This gives these areas much of the same strength found in the bony tissue found in other animals.

annotations.comment:
There is a grammatical necessity in Chinese to (in most cases) pose causal statements in reverse order from English; "because..., therefore,..." is the standard form in Chinese, although there is another form that reverses the order. Thus, while the first sentence of the Chinese features "because" (因为) and "therefore" (所以) and the English does not, this is not a substantive difference. 

The "tesserae" are noted in the Chinese as lending "very strong power" to the shark's mandible, while the English implies this, by suggesting that the shark's mandible is subject to enormous amounts of pressure yet "need[s]...strength." Of course, we also know from common sense that sharks can bite with some force--they are not manatees. The shark's mandible is said in the Chinese to be stronger than most bony (mandibular) structures. The English merely suggests that the shark's mandible is roughly equivalent to that of animals with "bony tissue."

premise: The average atmospheric pressure at sea level is defined by the International Standard Atmosphere as . This is sometimes referred to as a unit of standard atmospheres (atm). text: 雌性懒熊在经过210天的妊娠期后，诞下2只懒熊宝宝（一般在十二月至隔年一月生产）。 懒熊宝宝的出生地通常是洞穴内或巨石下，它们出生后的首三个月都在那里度过，之后再与母亲一起生活两年。 懒熊的移动速度比其他熊科动物要快，在行走、跑动或爬行时，懒熊宝宝会起在母亲背上，为了抓紧母亲，它们会互相争夺空间甚至打架。
premise: The breeding season for sloth bears varies according to location: in India, they mate in April, May, and June, and give birth in December and early January, while in Sri Lanka, it occurs all year. Sows gestate for 210 days, and typically give birth in caves or in shelters under boulders. Litters usually consist of one or two cubs, or rarely three. Cubs are born blind, and open their eyes after four weeks. Sloth bear cubs develop quickly compared to most other bear species: they start walking a month after birth, become independent at 24–36 months, and become sexually mature at the age of three years. Young cubs ride on their mother's back when she walks, runs, or climbs trees until they reach a third of her size. Individual riding positions are maintained by cubs through fighting. Intervals between litters can last two to three years.

annotations.comment:
The English uses a sex-specifying term to describe the female sloth bear, while the Chinese refers to female sloth bears directly ("雌性懒熊"). 

The English does not specify what proportion of the overall sloth bear population is found in India and Sri Lanka, respectively. Thus, it is unclear whether the case for India--that bears "give birth in December and early January"--or that for Sri Lanka--"it occurs all year"--represents the case for the majority of bears, and therefore the "typical" breeding behavior of the bears. This is relevant to the claim in the Chinese that the bears "generally give birth between December and January of the following year," because we do not know which of the two aforementioned ranges (for India and Sri Lanka, respectively) to treat as "typical." Thus, I have labelled "一般" (meaning "generally") as "new" information, and the remainder of the phrase as "inferable."

CN: "The place of birth of sloth bear cubs is typically..."; EN: "Sows...typically give birth in..."

The Chinese describes the relative quickness of movement of sloth bears compared to other species of bear. This information is not found anywhere in the English.

The Chinese notes that the bear cubs "compete for space and even fight" "in order to grab a [firm] hold of their mother" while riding on her back.

premise: The impala is a medium-sized, slender-bodied antelope, comparable to the kob, puku and Grant's gazelle in size and built. Males reach approximately at the shoulder, while females are tall. Sexually dimorphic, females are hornless and smaller than males. Males grow slender, lyre-shaped horns long. The horns, strongly ridged and divergent, are circular in section and hollow at the base. Their arch-like structure allows interlocking of horns, which helps a male throw off his opponent during fights; horns also protect the skull from damage.

annotations.comment:

Nonetheless, we can say, therefore, that the Chinese description of female height being "at the shoulder" could be inferable. In the final analysis, the data missing from the English ("Males reach approximately at the shoulder, while females are tall") means that we cannot annotate the shoulder specification of the height measurement for females given by the Chinese as "inferable."

CN, regarding horns: "partly curved/crooked/bent"; EN, regarding horns: "lyre-shaped," "arch-like"--both descriptions seem to be in accord, and it can be deduced from both that the horns are not straight. The CN does describe the horns as "bow-shaped," rather than "arch-like," but the idea is more or less the same.

text: 伦理学方面，康德否定意志受外因支配的说法，而是认为意志是与生俱来的，而不是从后天获得。 康德认为真正的道德行为是纯粹基于义务而做的行为，而为实现某一个个人功利目的而做事情就不能被认为是道德的行为。 因此康德认为，一个行为是否符合道德规范并不取决于行为的后果，而是采取该行为的动机。 康德还认为，只有当我们遵守道德法则时，我们才是自由的，因为我们遵守的是我们自己制定的道德准则，而如果只是因为自己想做而做，则没有自由可言，因为你就成为各种事物的奴隶。

He argues that the moral law is a principle of reason itself, not based on contingent facts about the world, such as what would make us happy; to act on the moral law has no other motive than "worthiness to be happy.

title: 伊曼努尔·康德
translation3: In terms of ethics, Kant denies that the will is controlled by external factors, but believes that the will is innate rather than acquired. Kant believes that true moral behavior is behavior based purely on obligation, and doing things to achieve a certain personal utilitarian purpose cannot be considered a moral behavior. Therefore, Kant believed that whether an action is moral or not depends not on the consequences of the action, but on the motivation for taking the action. Kant also believes that we are free only when we abide by moral laws, because we abide by the moral rules we have formulated ourselves, and if we do it just because we want to do it, there is no freedom at all, because you become A slave to all things.

text: 1818年，從美國南塔克特出發，以喬治·華盛頓·加德納爲船長的捕鯨船地球號（Globe）在南美洲海岸以西約1000英里的赤道處發現抹香鯨的「主礦脈」。 1820年，他帶著2000桶以上的抹香鯨油和新發現回到堪稱世界捕鯨業中心的南塔克特。 這新發現使得大批捕鯨船湧向代號爲“離岸漁場”（Offshore Grounds）的新捕鯨場。 加拉帕戈斯羣島從而成爲捕鯨船來回航程上的停靠熱點，以至群島上設有某種非正式的郵局，讓捕鯨船隊得以在此收發信件；此外也能補給和修理船隻。
premise: In 1818 the Nantucket whaleship Globe, under Captain George Washington Gardner, discovered a "mother lode" of sperm whales some thousand miles west of the South American coast approximately at the equator. He returned to Nantucket in 1820 with more than 2,000 barrels of sperm whale oil and the news of his discovery. This led to an influx of whaleships to exploit the new whaling ground and the Galápagos Islands became a frequent stop for the whalers both before and after visiting what came to be known as the Offshore Grounds. This led to the establishment in the Galápagos Islands of a kind of unofficial "post office" where whaleships stopped to pick up and drop off letters as well as for provisioning and repairing.

annotations.comment:

The Chinese reads roughly as "with George Washington Gardner [serving] as captain...," which is eminently inferable from the English: "under Captain George Washington Gardner...." In any case, to render the English directly into Chinese would involve the use of a nominalized verb missing from the English (most likely "leadership," "direction," etc.), so it is probably impossible to avoid having some "new" (albeit inferable) information here when comparing Chinese and English versions.

CN: "the equatorial area" (赤道处); EN: "approximately at the equator"

Nantucket is described as "the global center of whaling" (which is a true claim), but this is not supported in any significant way by the English. 

There is a significant, but subtle, difference in the two paragraphs here: EN: "an influx of whaleships to exploit the new whaling grounds and...became a frequent stop for the whalers...before and after visiting what came to be known as the Offshore Grounds."; CN: "the new discovery led a large number of whaling ships to head toward the new whaling area that came to be known as the "Offshore Grounds."

There is some variation in how the Chinese expresses the ideas contained in the final sentence of the English paragraph; but the Chinese segment adds nothing new that the English does not contain explicitly or imply.

title: 科隆群岛
translation3: In 1818, the whaling ship Globe, captained by George Washington Gardner, departed from Nantucket in the United States and discovered the "main vein" of sperm whales at the equator, about 1,000 miles west of the coast of South America. In 1820, he returned to Nantucket, the center of the world's whaling industry, with more than 2,000 barrels of sperm whale oil and new discoveries. This new discovery caused a large number of whaling ships to flock to the new whaling grounds code-named "Offshore Grounds". The Galapagos Islands became a hotspot for whaling ships on their voyages back and forth, and the islands even had a sort of informal post office where the whaling fleets could send and receive letters, as well as supply and repair their ships.

text: 1894年富有的波士顿人帕西瓦尔·罗威尔创立了罗威尔天文台；1906年罗威尔开始搜索可能存在的第九大行星——X行星。 1915年3月19日的巡天已拍摄到两张带有模糊的冥王星图像的照片，但是这些图像并没有被正确辨认出来。 已知的此类前向重建照片还有15张，最早可追溯至叶凯士天文台于1909年8月20日拍摄的照片。
premise: In 1906, Percival Lowell—a wealthy Bostonian who had founded Lowell Observatory in Flagstaff, Arizona, in 1894—started an extensive project in search of a possible ninth planet, which he termed "Planet X". By 1909, Lowell and William H. Pickering had suggested several possible celestial coordinates for such a planet. Lowell and his observatory conducted his search until his death in 1916, but to no avail. Unknown to Lowell, his surveys had captured two faint images of Pluto on March 19 and April 7, 1915, but they were not recognized for what they were. There are fourteen other known precovery observations, with the earliest made by the Yerkes Observatory on August 20, 1909.

annotations.comment:
The Chinese does not suggest (as the English does) that "Planet X" (X行星) was a name coined by Lowell. 

In other words, technically speaking, Lowell was not searching for Planet X per se, but for the hypothesized ninth planet of the solar system, which he referred to as "Planet X."

EN: "his surveys"; CN: "the cosmic/astronomical surveys" (巡天)

The Chinese claims that Lowell's surveys captured "two...photographs" on March 19, 1915 alone, while the English implies that one photograph was captured on March 19, and another on April 7; therefore, although the highlighted segment (两张, meaning "two [followed by a measure word used for photographs, 张)" is not "new" in itself, the claim that it produces is new, in that it contradicts information given in the English. 

Also, the English does not specify that the images of Pluto were captured on or by photographs (照片), but it is inferable (and appears in the Chinese) that such was the case. premise: Though Wilson's idealism pervaded the Fourteen Points, he also had more practical objectives in mind. He hoped to keep Russia in the war by convincing the Bolsheviks that they would receive a better peace from the Allies, to bolster Allied morale, and to undermine German war support. The address was well received in the United States and Allied nations and even by Bolshevik leader Vladimir Lenin, as a landmark of enlightenment in international relations. Wilson subsequently used the Fourteen Points as the basis for negotiating the Treaty of Versailles, which ended the war.

annotations.comment:
The Chinese argues that the "Fourteen Points 'peace principles' represent Wilson's political idealism." For one, although we see the Fourteen Points referred to in the English merely by that name, we know that this document, or accord, had to do with "peace," especially the settlement of the First World War--we know it was that particular war, in turn, for a number of reasons, but particularly because Woodrow Wilson was the president in 1918.

Moreover, the context of diplomacy, international agreements, and presidential action suggest that this is Wilson's "political idealism" that is being referred to. 

As for "represent" (代表), if Wilson's "idealism pervaded" the document, then the document strongly reflected Wilson's idealism; in that case, the document itself likely "represented" his idealism; one would not inject, whether intentionally or not, one's ideals into a document with which one's ideals were opposed in the first place. For instance, a "peace treaty" drafted by a notoriously bellicose, bloodthirsty warlord could not resound with his "ideals," because "peace" is not among them. Therefore, it could not "represent" his ideals, either, because a peace document is antithetical, as an object, to his modus operandi and ideals, which would be better encapsulated in a declaration of war. 

Lenin's perspective on the value of the Fourteen Points is reflected in the apparently neutral description put forth in the Chinese (也造就国际联盟...).

text: 1998年9月6日午後0時45分、黑澤明於東京都世田谷区成城的自家住宅因為腦中風逝世，享年88歲。 同年9月13日舉行告別式，包含岡本喜八、司葉子、谷口千吉、仲代達矢、香川京子、千秋実、侯孝賢等人在內約35000人出席田沼雄一「黒澤明監督・お別れの會ルポ 今日はハッピーエンドです」。 黑澤明因為生前無宗教信仰，過身後與先逝的妻子（1985年逝世）合葬在鎌倉市的，戒名「映明院殿紘國慈愛大居士」。
premise: After his accident, Kurosawa's health began to deteriorate. While his mind remained sharp and lively, his body was giving up, and for the last half-year of his life, the director was largely confined to bed, listening to music and watching television at home. On September 6, 1998, Kurosawa died of a stroke in Setagaya, Tokyo, at the age of 88. At the time of his death, Kurosawa had two children, his son Hisao Kurosawa who married Hiroko Hayashi and his daughter Kazuko Kurosawa who married Harayuki Kato, along with several grandchildren. One of his grandchildren, the actor Takayuki Kato and grandson by Kazuko, became a supporting actor in two films posthumously developed from screenplays written by Kurosawa which remained unproduced during his own lifetime, Takashi Koizumi's After the Rain (1999) and Kei Kumai's The Sea is Watching (2002).

Approximately 35,000 people, including Kihachi Okamoto, Tsukasa Yoko, Senkichi Taniguchi, Tatsuya Nakadai, Kyoko Kagawa, Chiaki Mi, Hou Hsiao-hsien, etc., attended Yuichi Tanuma's "Supervisor Akira Kurosawa・お BETTING NO kai Rana" "Today's はハッピーエンドです". Because Akira Kurosawa had no religious beliefs during his lifetime, he was buried in Kamakura City with his late wife (who passed away in 1985) and was given the inscription "Eimei-in Den Hōkuni, the Great Patriarch of Kindness".

text: 卡拉奇是巴基斯坦最重要的经济城市，工业、进出口贸易、交通运输业等均处全国领先地位，并有大量的国有经济实体。 全市GDP和关税额分别占全国的20%和65%以上，工业、工业产品和产业工人分别占全国总量的47%、43%和42%。
premise: Industry contributes a large portion of Karachi's economy, with the city home to several of Pakistan's largest companies dealing in textiles, cement, steel, heavy machinery, chemicals, and food products. The city is home to approximately 30 percent of Pakistan's manufacturing sector, and produces approximately 42 percent of Pakistan's value added in large scale manufacturing. At least 4500 industrial units form Karachi's formal industrial economy. Karachi's informal manufacturing sector employs far more people than the formal sector, though proxy data suggest that the capital employed and value-added from such informal enterprises is far smaller than that of formal sector enterprises. An estimated 63% of the Karachi's workforce is employed in trade and manufacturing.

annotations.comment:
The Chinese asserts that Karachi is "the most important 'economic city' (经济城市) in Pakistan"; the English does not suggest this, either implicitly or explicitly. It does, however, note Karachi's economic importance within Pakistan in some specific areas. The Chinese then lists the domains of "industry, import and export trade, and transportation and logistics," before describing Karachi as the national leader in each; the English does not do the same. 

The Chinese does, however, describe Karachi's major share of Pakistan's "value added" in manufacturing, but does not include "large scale" manufacturing in this statement.

translation3: Specific phobia affects about 6 to 8% of the population in Western countries every year, and about 2 to 4% of the population in Asia, Africa, and Latin America suffer from specific phobia every year. Social phobia affects about 7% of the population in the United States and other parts of the world. 0.5~2.5%, agoraphobia affects about 1.7% of people. text: 而英澳紐體系現行對新聘講師（lecturer）的學歷要求，也基本為博士畢業（或極少數情形為即將畢業）才有資格，因此該職相當於北美（美加）體制下的助理教授（assistant professor）。 英制的講師已經可以協助指導博士生，也要負責研究成果；美國體系與英國、澳大利亞、紐西蘭不同，美國的大學講師則通常只負責教學，沒有負責學術研究。
premise: A professor is an accomplished and recognized academic. In most Commonwealth nations, as well as northern Europe, the title professor is the highest academic rank at a university. In the United States and Canada, the title of professor applies to most post-doctoral academics, so a larger percentage are thus designated. In these areas, professors are scholars with doctorate degrees (typically PhD degrees) or equivalent qualifications who teach in four-year colleges and universities. An emeritus professor is a title given to selected retired professors with whom the university wishes to continue to be associated due to their stature and ongoing research. Emeritus professors do not receive a salary, but they are often given office or lab space, and use of libraries, labs, and so on.

annotations.comment: If the term "professor" (in the North American context) is, as the English informs us, refers to "most post-doctoral academics," then most "professors" are "post-doctoral," which means that most "professors" have a doctorate. Thus, we can infer from the English that, as the Chinese suggests, "lecturer" in the Commonwealth sense is similar to an "assistant professor" in the North American system in that both categories almost always comprise academics with doctoral degrees.

title: 教授
translation3: The current academic requirements for newly hired lecturers in the Anglo-Australian and New Zealand system are basically those who have graduated with a PhD (or are about to graduate in rare cases), so this position is equivalent to an assistant professor (assistant professor) under the North American (U.S. and Canada) system. assistant professor). Lecturers in the British system can already assist in supervising doctoral students and are also responsible for research results; the American system is different from the United Kingdom, Australia, and New Zealand. University lecturers in the United States are usually only responsible for teaching and not for academic research.
